other_tests.findings: Lower thorax shows bibasilar atelectasis. Hepatic steatosis without fat fraction of 13.5%. A 6 mm focus of arterial enhancement at the inferior right lobe of the liver, likely perfusional. Mild dilatation of the proximal intrahepatic bile ducts. The common bile duct is mildly dilated, measuring 8 mm, and there is low, medial insertion of the cystic duct without intraluminal filling defect. The gallbladder is surgically absent.
